choices: Daria and Jane
Quinn and the Fashion Club
Jodie and Mack
Brittany and the cheerleaders
Or someone else?
1.content:
brinnngg The bell rang, signaling the beginning of "Another delicious lunch period in the glorious halls of Laaaawndale High!" said Jane, in a surprising good imitation of Ms Li, their dictatorial principle.

"Now Jane, you know that's not nice. Who knows, the food might be edible today. It's the second Tuesday after the first Wednesday, after all" Daria bandied back with a smirk, as the pair passed Quinn and the rest of the fashion fiends heading the other direction.

"Ugh! Quinn, why does your 'cousin' or whatever have to be soo weird?!" Sandi demanded.

"Oh look!" began Quinn nervously, in an obvious attempt at changing the subject. "I think I see an open table over there, behind Jodie and Mack; over next to Britney and the other cheerleaders."

So who do you want to follow today?
1.title: Weighty decisions

choices: Stay with Jane to explore her 'physical condition'?
Stay with Daria, now facing a double helping of lunch?
Rejoin our heroines along with the rest of their class in PE?
Jump ahead to the Pizza Prince, after school?
The ever popular 'Something Else'!
11.content:
Ten minutes of snide commentary and gustatorial abuse later, Jane finally pushed her lunch tray. "Urg, I don't know how you can do it, Morgendorffer. This mystery meat is institutionalized torture; emphasis on the 'institutional', of course" she panned, gesturing to include the whole of Lawndale High.

"Our textbooks don't cover the Geneva Conventions, so why should the nutritional guidelines?" Daria shot back. "But in my case, years of Mom's microwave lasagna and Dad's culinary experiments have built up my tolerance. Pizza Prince after school then?"

"Never thought I'd see the day anyone could out stomach one of the latchkey Lanes. Sure, I'll meet you there," responded Jane, standing up. "I'm going to go get a quick run to unwind before math."

"You exercise too much, Lane; it'll kill you yet."

"Heh, we'll see who's laughing come PE, 6th period," Jane drawled with an evil grin. "I hear Ms. Morris is planning another of her special 'focus' events, complete with mandatory volunteering."

Thump. Daria let her head fall to the table, narrowly missing her plate of...um. Well, missing her plate, anyways. "Kill me now."

"And deny myself the fun of seeing you suffer and die later?" Jane asked with a smirk. "'Til then," she said jauntily over her shoulder as she turned to leave.

Do you want to:
11.title: Table for Two, with a side order of wit

choices: Jane looks at her stomach, she's starting to get pudgy!
Janes actually lost some weight. Time to carbo load!
Jane is getting sick, and will need to stay home and rest(and eat)
111.content:
For Jane, running had always been a way to deal with problems. Stressed? Run? Horny? Run? Scared? Run? Being chased by a homeless guy? Most DEFINITELY run!

Lawndale Highs track was certainly decent, assuming you ignored the overgrown sections and beer cans.

Jane ran around the corner, having completed her second lap. "Man, panting I'm not usually this tired until panting the fourth lap."
As Jane began her third lap, her panting intensified.
"Whats wrong with panting me?"

With her third lap finished, Jane stopped to catch her breath. She was WAY more tired then usual.

"I don't understand." She said, as she took a long sip of water.
111.title: Running from your problems....errrr...food.

choices: Two weeks of recovery(and stuffing herself, and not exercising) later
That night, when Daria comes to visit.
About a week in, Jane notices something
1113.content:
Shortly after, Jane threw up all over the bunch.

She was sent home shortly after to recover.

"Damn sickness. Couldn't it have struck someone more stupid? Or atleast 'ACHOO'..atleast sent a two weeks notice. Viruses these days, I tell ya."

Jane walked back into her room. With Trent on tour, and Daria still at school, all she could do was sit back, watch TV....and eat.

"Mmm....Pizza." Jane had several full pizzas worth of slices, not to mention plenty of sweets.

She was going to have a long and slow recovery.

"May as well enjoy it."
1113.title: Jane is getting sick, and will need to stay hom...

choices: Quinn and Sandi try to out-eat eachother to prove they don't need to diet
Stacy goes to the vending machine between classes for some comfort food
After school Tiffany decides to fix being 'too thin'.
Skip all that, and go to the Fashion Club's sleepover later tonight
Something else
12.content:
Arriving at their chose table, the four sat down. Looking down at her lunch, Tiffany drawled out her perpetual question "Aaam I faat?"

"Gosh, no, Tiffany. You're so skinny" Stacy responded perkily. "Wish I could be skinny," Stacy continued, in a half-audible mutter, giving her mid-section a poke.

"She's right Tiffany; you really don't need to worry about being fat. You ask us this every day. Just eat, already" Quinn added, a bit peremptorily. "If anything, you're too thin; you barely have any curves as it is."

As the conversation turned else where, two phrases rolled through Tiffany's head 'Tooo thinnn...?' and 'Just eat.'

"Gee Quinn, you sure don't have that problem. But are you sure you really want to eat all that?" Sandi asked in her typical snotty voice. "I mean you're already 'curvy' enough" Sandi smirked to herself, as see her barbed insinuation had slid home.

Quinn subtly tugged her shirt down further over her recently soft belly. "Oh no, Sandi, I can eat anything I want. With my figure and my fast metabolism I never have any worries about that" Quinn turned the question around in a form of conversation jiujutsu. "But I think I saw some light salad dressing at the salad bar; maybe you'd like some?"

"No, Quinn. You are mistaken. Like you, I am much to thin and fit to ever worry about something like that. Don't you agree?" Sandi bit back bitterly, feeling she had lost a point in their perpetual game. And to prove her point, she dug in to her meal heartily forcing Quinn to do the same, to keep up appearances, calling her bluff. As she did, Sandi thought to herself 'Damn it. As if these pants weren't already tight enough today.'
12.title: And so it begins

choices: Half carried by the 3 Js, Quinn staggers forth, queasy but triumphant
Sandi claims a pyrrhic victory, and must now deal with her unclosable fly
121.content:
"I'll show her who needs to watch what she eats!" Sandi thought viciously, as she shoveled another loaded spoonful of mashed potatoes into her mouth. By this time she was barely taking the time to chew, as she furiously plowed through the meal heaped on her lunchroom tray. "I am not letting Quinn show me up this time!"

See in her adversary step up the pace, Quinn turned to where Joey, Jeffy, and Jamie were watching this display of passion and appetite with rapt, if somewhat confused, attention. "Oh dear" she lilted, in patent insincerity, "I seem to be almost out. Would one of you boys like to get me something more to eat? I'd be ever so grateful" she giggled. "That stone-hearted bitch! Can't Sandi see what she's forced us into now?" Quinn thought furiously, behind her assumed mask of gaiety. "Urg, I feel sick, but damned if I'm going to let her show me up!" she finished grimly, even as she ripped off a great hunk of bread with her teeth.

As she leaned forward over her soup (the special of the day - grey with brown bits) Sandi surreptitiously reached under the table in an attempt to loosen the waist band of her slacks. "Perhaps to day was not the best day to have worn my size 00 slacks," she reflected. Then, rallying "But it's all Quinn's fault! She knew they were all ready fashionably tight" and maybe a bit tighter, she scrupulously did not point out to herself.
"Ahhhh.... That's so much better" she sighed, as her formerly concave abdomen surged forward nearly an inch into a tight, bloated curve as she finally succeed in unbuttoning her pants.

"What was that Sandi?" Quinn asked, leaning back from her second plateful of the school's mystery meat special (brown meat with grey sauce). "Damn it, there goes my shirt again" she thought to herself, reflexively trying to tug it back down to the more familiar region of her belly-button. "Shit, it keeps riding up. As much as I hate to admit it, I guess Mom was right about the universal advisedness of crop tops. At least my hip-huggers are low riding...which may not be entirely a good thing" she finished, as she noticed the boys eyeing her increasingly exposed midriff, and the first signs of her panties threatening to peak into view.

And so it went, until eventually...
121.title: Rivalry

choices: the table
the cheerleaders
1212.content:
Suddenly Quinn stopped eating and Sandi claimed victory.

However when Sandi stood up she remembered her undone fly which now allowed her paunch to hang out.

She heard laughter from....
1212.title: The Agony of Victory

choices: gum
blood
12121.content:
Sandi looks around to see who is laughing.
Once she finds out who it is she goes up to them and punches them. When she turns around she realizes everyone in the cafeteria is looking up at the ceiling above her. She looks up as well and sees that there is a whole wad of.....
12121.title: People laugh

choices: Pig out  an all-you-can-eat buffet...
Gorge on ice cream & cerial at home...
123.content: After Sandi's broken leg incident, Tiffany noticed that even though they had recently passed the "Maximum weight acceptance policy" none of the other students thought it was just a lie. One night earlier Sandi had declared that their club's standards were too high; and due to recent developments of Spain adding plus-size models to its inventory many people thought the United States ought to do the same thing. With that, Tiffany realized she had to pass on the message that the Fashion Club had lowered its standards & the only way to do that and convince them of it was that Tiffany had to gain weight. Immediately after school she decided to...
123.title: Tiffany packs it in

choices: The Next Morning
1232.content:
Tiffany walked home, a vacant look in her eye.

Tiffany spent most of her time worrying about her figure. Does this make me look fat had become her catchphrase.
The girl wasn't very bright, fell easy to suggestion.

And right now, she could only think one thing.

Too thin.
Just eat.

And eat she did. Like a model on a mission, she stuffed her face with everything she could.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------< br /> A few hours later, a very bloated Tiffany stumbled to her mirror, looking at her tight drum of a belly.

She then tried on clothes, as usual, except....with a different goal in mind.

As she looked at her skinny jeans, letting out a rank fart, she stuck out her gut as far as she could, and said...

"Doeeeesss thisss makkkkeee meeeeeee loooooook thhiiiiiiinnnn?"
1232.title: TOO THIN. JUST EAT. TOO THIN. JUST EAT.

choices: Status quo: Continuous stress eating
Subtle rebellion: After school binge
Full on revolt: No work, all play, and lots of eating
Corruption: Food and Romance
Something else
13.content:
Slumping up against Mack's solid mass, Jodie allowed herself to unwind fractionally, enough to gripe to her boyfriend. "God, Mack, I just don't know how much longer I can keep all this up."

"Your parents again?" Mack guessed.

"Well they're the originatal cause; always pushing me to take on more responsibilities, to participate in more extracurriculars, to be more competitive and driven. All just to prove that they, excuse me, that I don't have anything to prove. That they, whoops there I go again. That I am just as good as everyone else, because I'm better." Jodie sighed deeply, having vented her spleen for the moment, and dug into her lunch ravenously.

"Hang in there, babe; you'll pull through. You're one of the strongest people I know. I mean I certainly couldn't juggle everything you've got in the air. President of the French Club, Vice President of the Student Council, President of the Honor Society," said Mack supportively, as he opened his own lunch.

Jodie sighed again, swallowed her food, then chuckled and said, "You forgot editor of the school paper." She took another big bite. "My parents pick out what sport I play; they pick out most of my activities, and push me to be involved in more; they keep dumping most of the responsibility for taking care of my younger siblings at home. And on top of it all, they're always lecturing me about how I have to 'be an example for our race!'" ranted Jodie, in a frighteningly accurate mimicry of her mother. "I swear, it's like the only thing in my life that I actually have any say over is what I eat," she concluded, finishing her lunch, even as she looked longingly at the uneaten portion of Mack's.

She sighed again. "Maybe that's why I've been snacking so much more recently. Stress relief. And it's not doing my weight any favors either; another source of stress in it self."

It broke Mack's heart to hear Jodie, strong confident Jodie Landon, hurting like this. Wrapping his arm around her waist, he gave her tummy a gentle caress (not quite being bold enough to go any higher in such a public place) "Aw Jodie, I think you look great. You know how much I was enjoying your recent growth 'north of the navel' last night. And besides, I've always said you let what your parents think control you too much. But even if you're still going to do all the things they force you into, maybe even because of that, then I say what you eat, how much you weigh, that's none of their damn business."

Jodie smiled, and snuggled deeper into Mack's embrace. "Thanks, Mack. You all ways know the right thing to say. And you are absolutely right." She bit her lip delicately. "Um, are you going to finish that other sandwich?"
13.title: The Trials and Tribulatioins of Jodie Landon

choices: Temptation at the vending machine.
At dinner, after a day of grazing on junk food.
131.content:
Having left Mack at the end of lunch period with a last tender kiss, Jodie proceeded to her next class.

An hour and a half later, Jodie found her mind wandering. "Good thing this is study hall; no one will notice" she grinned to herself, as she tossed the wrapper of her most recent candy bar into the trash.

"Just wish I could actually use this time to study for a change. Instead I'm stuck here pounding my head against wall trying to finish up this presentation for the French Club, and then after that there's the planning for the dance next week. Groan. And I still have tennis practice after school."

Jodie scooted back from the her work, only to slump down in her seat, her recently fuller bust pushing her already tight sweater to the breaking point. "Wish I could concentrate." she thought to herself, her tongue darting out to garner the last taste of chocolate from her lips.

She straightened up again, tugging her sweater back into place. "Maybe a snack will help me perk up she mused. "If nothing else, it's an excuse to take a break for a minute" she added with a wry smile on her lips.

She leaned over to search her bag, giving the boy seated at the next table an unintended show. "That's funny, I could have sworn there were still two candy bars in here, and I know I started with 5 this morning. Damn it, did I eat them all already?" Jodie muttered. "Oh well, I'll just make a quick trip to the vending machine" she said, giving her shirt another tug; for some reason it just wasn't fitting very well today.
131.title: Status quo: Continuous stress eating

choices: Grab the food and hide, Jodie gorges in private.
Recruit her rebellious sister to join. The more the merrier.
132.content:
That afternoon, after her presentation to the French club and tennis practice were both over, Jodie walked down the front steps of the school, gratefully leaving the high-pressure Lawndale High behind her once again.

Practically dragging her feet in exhaustion, Jodie muttered to herself "After all that I'm exhausted and I'm starving, even after everything I ate at lunch. Mack is right; I can't keep doing this. My parents control everything I do. No, I let them control me. But they don't control everything. ...I just can't stand up to them in person." Reaching the parking lot, she eased herself into her car, grateful to be off her feet.

"But I honestly do like helping out, and damn it, I'm good at what I do" she continued in her mind. "And even if they do go overboard sometimes, they are right about how much good I can do as a symbol; Daria helped me recognize that at the parade." She drove on for a few more miles deep in thought.

"No," she decided reluctantly, "I can't just drop everything, at least not right away. But I do need to do something to take back some control in my life. Somehow, in some small way" she concluded, pulling into the driveway of her family's upper class home.

Her stomach still rumbling after her vigorous work out at school, Jodie comes to a sudden decision. "That's it; Mack was right again. Heh, he was really on a roll today." New found resolve stiffening her spine, Jodie strode back to the kitchen.

"Mom and Dad don't control what I eat, and even I don't think they have any right to do so!" she justified to herself, even as she raided the fridge, pulling out another arm load of food. "And if I gain weight? Ha! That'll just server them right."

"Take this Mom and Dad!" cried Jodie around a massive bite of her dagwood sandwich.

In response to that outburst, Jodie heard her little sister Rachel's voice drifting from the family "Jodie, is that you?"
132.title: Subtle rebellion: After school binge

choices: Eat some more
Do something else
1321.content:
Jodie had grabbed everything in the cupboards and fridge that her arms could carry to her room and she had locked the door to start gorging on everything she had.

She continued to gorge and she managed to finish the food but with a slightly bloated stomach, but she was wondering what to do next.

Her parents couldn't really control what she ate but looking past the few bad weeks she had a few bad days and eating a lot of food but she was sitting there empty packages strewn about she was wondering...

Wondering about whether or not to eat some more or do something else.
1321.title: Locked in the room and gorge

choices: Stay here, hang out and relax like teenagers, and eat cheap
Go somewhere better suited for a celebration
133.content:
"...assuré le succès du modèle de la Renaissance. Les années entre 1562 et 1598..." Jodie droned on, reading from her prepared note cards. "Mack was right; why am I doing this to myself? Why am I letting my parents push me to do this to myself? I don't care about this; I don’t care about any of this?" she thought to herself wearily, as she gazed out at the indifferent faces of the French Club.

A flash of realization: "Wait, I really don't care; Mack was right." "...Mack was right!" exclaimed Jodie, interrupting herself. "Excuse me, I've got somewhere, somewhere better to be," she toss over her shoulder as she hurried out the door.

Twenty minutes later, she was on the phone, talking to Mack. "...so that's when I realized just how right you were, Mack."

"Wow, that's some story. You don't know how glad I am that I could help you. So what are you going to do now?" he asked.

"Nothing - absolutely nothing. More specifically, I'm not letting my parents pressure me to participate in clubs in which I'm not interested, not letting them talk me into taking jobs I find morally degrading, and not letting them control what I eat or how I look. I'm done with that, all of it. From now on I'm concentrating on spending more time with you (finally), and not taking on anything unless I feel like it!" she concluded strongly. "So. Care to join me and help me celebrate my freedom, since you've been so helpful already? I'm at the Good Time Chinese Restaurant, over by the mall. If we wait another 10 minutes, we can get the cheap price at the afternoon buffet, or there's always the 2 for 1 special at Pizza King, across the street. Or if you've got a better idea, I'd love to hear it, perhaps something more romantic?" she hinted archly.

"Heh, sounds like somebody's hungry. Well, I was just on my way to football practice right now, but for a celebration like this, you definitely get the priority," Mack responded with a chuckle in his voice. "I'll be there in 20 minutes; we can talk about what we want to do then."
133.title: Full on revolt: No work, all play, and lots of eat

choices: "Getting fat? That's like totally grody! No way!" Now what?
"You're the captain, you should go first! We'll all help!" Stuff Brittany
"Me, Lisa, and Nicky are on the base, we'll start!" Feed half the team
"We're all in! But how do we bulk up?" Everyone, Pick a method
Something Else (tm)
14.content:
[With apologies to the original author of this chapter, I felt it could use a re-write.]

Dirty, sore, and limping, the Lawndale High cheerleading squad draggled into the cafeteria, taking their clique's usual table, just past the fasionistas and to one side of the geeks and brains.

Grimacing slightly as she rotated a shoulder, Lisa complained, "Ooooh, I don't understand it; every time we try a human pyramid, it keeps falling down."

"Like, I know!" squeaked Nicky. "Like, we really need to do something, or how will we ever support the team?"

"Weeell," drawled Brittany slowly, who despite her naivete and bubble-headed vapidness, tended to be the brains behind the group. "I think I heard Daria say something about us cheerleaders being 'top heavy'," she began in complete innocence. "And Daria's like, the biggest brain at Lawndale, so it has to be right. So maybe what we need is to put more weight at the bottom of the pyramid!" she chirped brightly.

Supported by the general positive murmuring of the flock, Angie ventured a question. "I guess that makes sense, but how do we do that? There's only so many girls we can fit at the bottom of the pyramid."

"Hmm, you're right, Angie. Oh, wait, I know!" said Brittany, bouncing excitedly at her epiphany. "If we can't put more girls at the bottom, we'll have to have more of them!"

"what? wait? huh? what do you?" Facing a wall of bovine confusion, Brittany expounded her brilliant idea further.

"Since we're too top heavy, the girls at the bottom of the pyramid will have to gain weight to balance us out!" She looked around proudly at her feat of deduction, faces of shock, distaste, and, surprising, a few of curiosity, looking back.

Hardening her face in determination, Brittany attempted to rally the troops. "Come on, girls. We're cheerleaders; it's not all fun and games. We have a sacred duty to support the boys on the team. How can help them win or pump up the crowd if we don't have a human pyramid?"

Quickly polling the swirling emotions around her, Angie once again took the lead for the squad. Taking a deep breath, she began, "Well, Brittany..."
14.title: which one

choices: Brittany pushes herself  with a trip out for pizza after school.
Daria gets wind of the plan, and amuses herself a bit at Brittany's expense.
Sandi encourages her rivals to "do what that POPULAR girl is doing".
142.content:
"Come on, Brittany! You can do it!" Angie encouraged. "You've already eaten three lunches and you've only got three lunches left to go, so that's like... more than half done already!"

Brittany slumped in her chair. "I don't know, you guys, my stomach is feeling really funny."

"Well, you're the captain. And it was your idea. Come on, Brittany. Brittany! Brittany! Brittany!"

The other girls joined in the chant. Brittany sat up with a groan. 'Full' was a new experience for her -- she couldn't remember the last time her strict diet and exercise regimen had allowed her to stuff herself like this. At first it had been fun, even if the school food was kind of gross, but she was starting not to like it so much. And the food was starting to be really gross.

"Brittany! Brittany! Brittany!"

Well, they were cheerleaders after all. They got results. The curvy blonde polished off another plate and a half of cafeteria slop, but that really was her limit.

When she got back to class, she was asleep almost before her head hit her desk. The next thing she knew, she was being shaken awake.

"Babe, wake up. Class is over."

"K-Kevvy? Where am I?"

"Dreamland, Babe! You were really out." Kevin laughed. "You kept snoring every time Mr. DiMartino tried to say something. I thought for sure that eye would finally pop out."

"Why didn't you wake me up! Oooh, now I'm going to be in trouble!"

"Aw, come on! It was funny!"

Brittany swept past him and marched over to the vending machines. She'd never used them before -- not with all those fattening snacks -- but now, well. She felt like she had a little room now, and the candy bars and snack cakes looked a lot better than that lunch had been.

"Hey, what are you doing?"

"I'm getting a snack, what's it look like?"

"Babe! You know you can't eat this stuff!"

"I can too. I'm on a special diet. For cheerleading."

Kevin scratched his head. "Special diet? Like in Cosmo or something? And you eat junk food on it?"

"Uh-huh! As much as I possibly can!"

Under Kevin's pads, his shoulders moved up and down in a shrug. "Well, if they say so. I guess it must be scientific or something. And it couldn't hurt you to lose a couple pounds, I guess."

Brittany's blonde eyebrows lowered. "We'll see." She chomped the end off of a chocolate bar and chewed determinedly.
142.title: Brittanic

choices: They decide to ask Brittany what she's doing
They decide to leave, leaving Brittany to her own devices.
Daria stares closer.Something about Brittanys stuffed gut is strangely appealing
1421.content:
Brittany stumbled out the front door, her gut gurgling. Who knew getting heavier was so hard?

As she walked out, rubbing her tummy, she realized something.

"Wait.....what am I gonna eat at home?"

Her parents would never go for this, they wouldn't understand.
Maybe she could get more change an..
Wait....

Brittany turned around, her eyes fell on the cynical duo themselves.

Daria and Jane walked by, chatting.

OF COURSE! PIZZA! Daria and Jane always ate Pizza!

Brittany smiled.

"I'll make my cheer team proud, I'll-UUUURRRRRP!....excuse me."

----------------------------------------------------------------------

Eating a whole pizza is a challenge in itself.

Eating a whole pizza after eating three school lunches and a pack of twinkies is something else.

Brittany did not look too good. Her stomach was bloated from all the over eating.

"Ohhh......URP...why did I ever.....PHHHRT....want to eat so mURP..uch."

She had long since stopped excusing herself, it simply felt good to let the gas out.

Daria and Jane had noticed Brittany stuffing herself like a turkey.

"Hmm, didn't know the cheerleaders were makeshift turkeys."

"Oh, come on, obviously they read the diet book upside down."

Daria and Jane smirked, before looking back at Brittany.
1421.title: Brittany pushes herself  with a trip out for pi...

choices: Helen Morgendorffer, Daria's mother
The Barksdales: Daria's aunts Rita and Amy, and/or cousin Erin
The school staff: Ms Li, Ms Defoe, Mrs Barch, and/or Mrs Bennett
The Lanes: Jane's Mother Amanda, and/or sisters Penny and Summer
Or someone else?
15.content: Ah, so you're a connoisseur of the less visible characters are you? Very good then. So who shall it be?
15.title: Someone else

choices: Helen glances at the body part in question as she passes the mirrors.
Distracted, Helen continues doesn't notice the fit of her skirt until later.
151.content:
Helen wanders into the attached bathroom off of the master bedroom, attempting to juggle her usual morning routine with her boss Eric's latest pathetic issue on which to need hand-holding, interrupting her personal time, her life, and to a large extent her family's.

Padding barefoot into her closet, clad only in her plain, serviceable cotton underwear, Helen kept up a steady patter of reassuring pabulum into the phone seemingly grafted to the side of her head. "Yes Eric, I know, but..." Interrupted, a look of annoyance shot across her handsome features as she bent down pick up a pair of shoes, unintentionally giving her husband Jake a delightful eyeful of her derriere.

"No I didn't know that her lawyer had..." she trailed off, rolling her eyes at Eric's insecurities, once more, as she was interrupted again. Setting the shoes down by the bed, Helen pulled down a skirt and blouse from their respective hangers. The set was a couple of years old, but one of her nicer combinations; she'd need it in court later today, and besides, she'd always like them, and hadn't worn them much recently.

"But couldn't this have waited until I got into the office?..." She set laid her clothes out on the bed as she strode briskly past Jake moved back into the bathroom to do her makeup before getting dressed, so as not to get any on her clothes. Coming more fully awake, a familiar admiring gleam came into Jake's eyes as he watched her retreating back.

"Oh, no! Eric, I'm not making light of the plight of Mrs. Reislweller-Muffington - of the Crew Neck Reislweller-Muffingtons - Or her poodle!" She pulled away from the phone momentarily to mutter under her breath "Damn bitch" as she worked brusquely, oblivious to Jake's stealthy approach. "Wha? Oh no Eric, I didn't say anything."

As Jake embraced Helen from behind, she gave an "Eep" of surprise, not at all upset. "Eric" she broke in firmly, "I'll call you back later. No, later." She hung up, tossing the phone over her shoulder.

Turning around in his arms, Helen smiled lazily, saying, "Jake, we really don't have time for this - Eep! Jake! You bad boy, goosing me like that. grrrrl What brought this on? Not that I mind," she asked with a sensual smile on tugging at her lips.

"Oh nothing," he replied airily. "I just can't get enough of my beautiful wife, who seems to grow more beautiful every year, and who is looking, and feeling, particularly wonderful this morning" he said flatteringly, as he massaged her full, fulsome, ass - the real reason his motor was running hot this morning.

"Come on, honey, I think Eric can do with out you for a few minutes - or longer," he said with a suggestive leer, drawing Helen back towards the bed. Caressing her ass, which he found this morning to be particularly full, ripe, round, and shapely.

A very enjoyable half hour later, after having thoroughly mussed the bed, each other, and the sensibilities of their two daughters down the hall with their noisy antics, a very sated Helen pulls away from her husband's caress to her rear end to continue.

"Odd" she thought to herself. "I know Jakey has always loved my ass, but he seemed to pay more attention to it this morning than he has in a long time," she continued, walking between the full-length mirror on her closet door and the vanity mirror over the sinks in the bathroom. "I wonder what that was all about..."
151.title: Morning romp: setting the stage

choices: Andrea, the plump goth

155.title: This is enough.

1553.content: NOTE TO THE AUTHOR, PLEASE, DELETE THE LAST CHAPTER AND THIS ONE SO I CAN CHANGE THE LAST OPTION TO EVERYONE! I REPEAT, DELETE THIS CHAPTER, AND CHAPTER 3!b}
1553.title: Everyone!

info.brief_description: Weight-gain interactive story for the old animated show "Daria".
info.description:
Help write the story of Daria Morgendorffer and her friends, family, adversaries, and acquaintances as they gain weight.

Restrictions? Personally, I'd like to try to avoid stuff that's too illegal or gory or pedophilic, and at least try to pretend everything that happens is consensual. Beyond that, I personally lean towards stories that have at least a passing nod towards realism and literary merit, and I reserve the right edit a chapter if I think it really needs help, but I will do my utmost best to avoid stepping on any toes of anyone who does contribute.

Within those guidelines though, it's wide open. I have no problem with swearing, violence, sexual orientation, kinks, politics, graphic scenes, or other so-called questionable or controversial content, as long as such things are not completely gratuitous and over top, and have at least some relation to developing the story. And even then, I'm inclined to be generous if the writing is decent.

So just have fun, and try not to mess up other people's story lines too much.

Just a note: I am assuming that most of the people who actualy find this story, much less contribute, will have a certain minimum level of familiarity with the show and the characters, but I realize that will not be true of everyone. For anyone not familiar with the show or the characters, here are a few good places to look for more information, stories (most much better than this humble attempt), and pictures of all descriptions:
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0118298/
http://dariaencyclopedia.blogspot.com/
http://www.outpost-daria.com/
http://www.thepaperpusher.net/forum/index.php
http://www.fanfiction.net/l/38/3/0/1/1/0/0/0/0/0/1/
